txt.en: 'Is this truly the companion to our youthful wine? My eyes tell me so, but my tongue calls them liars!'
'Hear, hear!'
Found a hat
Find some flowers
'It is tart - or perhaps merely bitter - and yet mellow. Or perhaps not so mellow as bland.'
'Yes, indeed!'
'Battles fought!'
Found some bread
'Well done. That was quite amusing.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Neldir has to say.
'Battles to come!'

'Well, my dear friends. If we've learned something tonight, it is that in drink old friends stay true. In taste, they may differ. Ha ha! Ha ha ha!\n\n'Let us wash away that unfortunate taste with another drink of Beren's Blood!'

'Why, to woo the heart of my Vanyalos! Oh, do not give such frowns, you goats. None of us have forgotten the procession of maids swooning over you, Hirluin. Nor that tale of climbing the circle-wall, with... what was her name, that one maid with the dark hair?'

'Beren's Blood?'

Imadan lets out a low whistle.

'You might say that old stuff's a bit beneath lords such as they. But I know what they're at. It's what they drank when they were young men and went free about the City. I suppose recollecting old times can recollect old thirsts, eh?

'There's some over there, among my stores. You may help yourself.'
'That was an invention of the minstrel Authlin, and what is more, I think you know it. Though I hold that she spread the tale with as much relish as the minstrel ever did.'

'I doubt it not, Hirluin. The maids ever fell under your cold spell.

'Old Authlin, though. Now there was a minstrel of uncommon gifts! And a bit of a mischief-maker, too, wasn't he? But who would not forgive words so sweetly sung, or deftly penned! Of war he sang and kings of old, of flowery vales and shepherd's pipes, and of fair-eyed maids.

'You, Neldir, you have lived in Minas Tirith all this time. Does he live and play still? You know not? I must learn his fate. My good [placeholder], may we lean upon your goodness once again? Will you go up into the Fourth Circle and learn what became of Authlin, Master Minstrel?'
You can clearly make out the mark Forlong spoke of
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Forlong has to say.
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Hirluin has to say.
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nListen to Forlong's reply.
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nListen to Neldir's interjection.
'If you could settle this question of whether the old Master's cane-mark has lasted to this day, or not, we should be ever so grateful.'
Search for these things in the Third Circle of Minas Tirith.\n\nLook for a hat, some bread, some flowers, and a small rug to help prove Neldir's point.
'The mark can be seen? And you swear to it? Well! I cannot shout at the sun that it is night, can I? Ha ha!\n\n'But we interrupted ourselves mid-tale. Please, carry on!'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Hirluin has to say.
'Well, what did you see? I was right, wasn't I?'

Forlong claims the mark can be found in the Third Circle, just north of the Pier.\n\nLook for a mark on the column where the old Master of the Burg swung at Forlong's head. Forlong claims it can still be seen but Hirluin disbelieves him.
'Well! As I was saying, there we were with some bottles of wine tucked in our arms, but I, for one, had also a hat, bread, some flowers, and a small rolled up rug.'
Carry the pile of things
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear to what Neldir has to say.

The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nFind some of the Old Calembel cheese that Forlong and his friends used to eat with their favourite wine. Start by asking Imadan, the barkeep of the Merry Swan.
The Middle Stores are in south part of the Third Circle.\n\nImadan has no Old Calembel cheese, but thinks the back reaches of the Middle Stores might have some.
The Middle Stores are in south part of the Third Circle.\n\nThey have some Old Calembel deep at the back of the Middle Stores. You should gather some for Forlong's table.

'And there we were, stumbling down the darkened street, all that wine and what-have-you stuffed under our coats! Now what was it called, that wine? The name escapes me! And to think I drank so very much of it in those years!

'Ah, hold your tongue, Hirluin! I hear the dart of wit upon it before you ever moved your lips. Forgetting comes of drinking, you will say, and so that wine was its own undoing. I guess correctly, do I not? Ha ha! But let me think one moment... was it? ... yes! Beren's Blood, it was named. How I should like a taste of that wine now!

'You there, my good [placeholder]. Since you are standing right at hand, be so good as to go ask old Imadan if he has got any.'
Lord Forlong sits in the Merry Swan Tavern, drinking with his old friends Lord Hirluin and one Neldir of Minas Tirith, making the most of the calm before the storm.
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nBring the cheese back to the Merry Swan.
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nForlong, Hirluin, and Neldir have tasted the Old Calembel. See how they liked it.
Return to Hirluin
'The entire City knew where we were supposed to be...'
Found some flowers
'And it was not stumbling through the darkened streets of the Craftsmen's Tier, I can tell you that!'
Listen to Forlong
'You are an old dog, Forlong. One of the best!'
Found a small rug
'But those days of our youth, what days they were.'
'So there I was, soot covering me from head to toe...'
You place the bottle reverently at the stone's base
'Come now, friend. You jest!'
'Ah, ha ha ha!'
'That is rich, is it not?'
'You know me too well, old friend!'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nLord Forlong has recalled an old wine they used to drink, named Beren's Blood, and has asked you to bring him some.
Neldir combines the items into a rough pile
The three friends raise their glasses and drink
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nImadan has some of the Beren's Blood wine Forlong wants. You should gather some yourself from the storage area.
The three solemnly partake of bread and cheese
The things tumble from your hands!
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nBring the wine back over to Forlong's table.
Here was Authlin's favourite place to sing
Talk to Forlong
Talk to Neldir
Talk to Hirluin
Listen to Forlong
Listen to Forlong
Listen to Hirluin
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Forlong has to say.
Listen to Forlong
'Lords Forlong, Hirluin, and Neldir? They've been at it for hours and might be for hours still.'
Authlin's favourite spot was across from the Artists' Fellow-hall in the Fourth Circle.\n\nPlace the empty bottle of Beren's Blood at Authlin's favourite spot, to commemorate the old minstrel.
'Come looking for my lords up there? You need but follow the sound of laughter.'

'Hold! Hold! This is too much. Confess, Forlong, for NOW you have embellished! Ah, I know that set of the jaw. You stand by your story, do you? So be it.\n\n'Friend [placeholder], as you have not wandered off, I wonder if you will settle another quibble. Can you find such things as these and bring them here? Surely they can all be found somewhere in this Circle. What did you say, Forlong? It was a hat, some bread, some flowers, and a small rug?'
Ask Imadan for Beren's Blood wine
'Oh, I remember Lord Forlong and the rest from days gone by. Lifts my heart to see them there.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nReturn to the Merry Swan and tell Forlong the bottle has been placed at Authlin's favourite stone.
Listen to Hirluin
Take some Beren's Blood wine ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
In Days of Youth
Listen to Forlong
Ask after Authlin ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Return with the wine
Listen to Hirluin
Look for the mark on the column
Return to Forlong
Took a bottle of wine ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The three friends raise their glasses and drink
Talk to Neldir
Find a small rug
Raise a glass
Ask Imadan for Old Calembel
Listen to Forlong
Place the bottle at Authlin's stone
'I haven't had any Old Calembel in years. But you might find some in the Middle Stores.'
Ask for Old Calembel in the Middle Stores
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nListen to Forlong's reply.
The things tumble from your hands!
Return to Neldir
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Hirluin has to say.

Hirluin catches your arm as you come up.

'Give that wine here, friend. Should you place it before Forlong, we others might never have a taste.'

This is met with hearty laughter, not least by Forlong himself.

'Here friends - a glass for you Neldir, a glass for me, yes, and one for you, Forlong, old friend. To our days of youth!'
Return to Forlong
'To Authlin!'
'If we've got any Old Calembel, it's far at the back. Take any you find in there. Nobody else seems to want it.'
'To youth! And also to age!'
'To life well lived!'
'Why, what have we here? It is a memory in the round, my friends! I thank you, good [placeholder]. Hirluin, hand me that bread. Forlong, the knife. Let us put fond memory to our lips.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nHear what Forlong has to say.
'Why, what have we here? It is a memory in the round, my friends! I thank you, good [placeholder]. Hirluin, hand me that bread. Forlong, the knife. Let us put fond memory to our lips.'
Take some Old Calembel ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'Ho ho! This is a mess! I am sorry, friend. Forlong, we see through your plans now. You fed us one truth in hopes we would swallow a lie!\n\n'But tell me, even if you could bear all that in your arms, why in Isildur's name WOULD you?'
Return with the wine
Bring the cheese to Neldir
Carry the pile of things
'That wasn't how it went at all. You haven't the grasp, and besides, your heart wasn't in it!'
Bring the cheese to Neldir
Go up to the Fourth Circle and see if anyone knows what became of the minstrel Authlin.
Took Old Calembel ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Return to Authlin's favourite spot

'And with one sip, a flood of memories! How we sat at this very table, night upon night. Our glasses full of Beren's Blood and Old Calembel cheese upon our plates.\n\n'[placeholder], you have kindly furnished us with the wine. Can you find us the cheese, as well? Do some old men a kindness!'
Listen to Neldir

'Old Calembel? Ah, well. I don't know what to say, but that some things linger and some things fade away. I haven't had any of that cheese for a good many years. Though now that I think of it, you might try the back of the Middle Stores, just up the way. You'll find all kinds of things back there, you will.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nYou have learned what became of Authlin, Master Minstrel. Now you should return to Forlong and company in the Merry Swan.

'And look, we have drained this bottle of Beren's Blood. Why, friend, I know what you should do. You should run and place it on that stone he loved, as a tribute to his memory. Yes, that is just the thing!'
Three solemnly partake of bread and cheese
'Do us a kindness and see if Imadan's got some Old Calembel cheese lying around.'
'Lord Forlong here must not be indulged or allowed such extravagant tales. Do see if you can find those things somewhere nearby.'
'What? Old Calembel? Aye, I think we might well have some, farther in. I'm not going back there. If you want some, you'll need to go yourself.'
Forlong and his friends are in the Merry Swan, in the Third Circle of Minas Tirith.\n\nDrink with Forlong and company.
'You will see, Neldir. It can be done and I did it!'
'Hm... Is this claim to be the wine... or the cheese?'
'The bottle is placed? That is good. We did well to honour old Authlin.'\n\nForlong closes his eyes and for a moment, the garrulous conversation comes to a rest.
'How marvelous! You have brought the things. Now we will put it to the test. Can you walk from here to there and carry these? I do not even ask you to run.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nReturn to the Merry Swan and tell Hirluin the mark can, in fact, be seen.
'But now we have our wine and our regrettable cheese. Finish your tale, Forlong. You had so many bottles of Beren's Blood under your coats... and what then?'
'Be a good [placeholder] and ask old Imadan if he's got any Beren's Blood wine, would you?'

'Why, old Minast√∫r, the last Master of the Burg stumbled across us! It was blind luck, and very bad at that. He knew at once we were the ones who'd done it, and he set to chasing us, waving that iron cane he went about with at us most menacingly!\n\n'In fact, he swung at my head and nearly took it off. To this day, there is a mark against the stone that he hit instead!'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nListen to Forlong continue his tale.

'Ah, now you go too far! I will not allow such a wanton claim to stand. Someone must be sent. You, [placeholder], will you go out on the street and show this for a braggart's lie? It was just north of the Pier, Forlong, was it not? Against an alley-column? Yes. Will you go and see?'
'That old Beren's Blood wine is over yonder, among the storage. Take what you please.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nBring the things you have gathered back to Neldir, in the Merry Swan.
'If you are looking for Authlin, you have missed him by ten years. Though, for what it's worth, I have heard he died with a glass of wine in his hand and a song on his lips.'

'How many times have I heard Authlin the Minstrel's name spoken? There are many tales told of that man. Why that patch of green, across the way over there, was his favourite place to perform. They say the night air filled with his harp as he stood there and played sweet melodies to the stars.'

Hirluin catches your arm as you come up.

'Give that wine here, friend. Should you place it before Forlong, we others might never have a taste.'

This is met with hearty laughter, not least by Forlong himself.

'Here friends - a glass for you Neldir, a glass for me, yes, and one for you, Forlong, old friend. To our days of youth!'

'Authlin? Why I knew him well, perhaps better than most, though I have not seen him in many a year. I will tell you something I remember of him. Sometimes, after a night of drink and merriment and song, he would confess to me that though his heart burned bright, there was a well of sorrow in it, too, and they ever wrestled. Sorrow for what, he would never tell. And then, sometimes, he would tell me he meant to fight the sorrow and love all the world until he knew his time had come, and then how sweet his rest would be. That is what he told me.'

'So Authlin lived a good life and died a willing death? Truly, that is the wisdom of old Westernesse!\n\n'Let us honour him and raise a glass. You, too, friend [placeholder]! You have earned your place, I think!'
Listen to Neldir
Find a hat
'I will confess, this is not how I remembered it. Ha ha! No, it is quite... different.'
The Merry Swan Tavern is on the southern end of the Third Circle.\n\nTry to carry the pile of things across the room.
Find some bread
